Arpa Şehriye Çorbası.recipe:
1) Sauté finely chopped onion and grated carrot in olive oil/butter for 3–4 min.
2) Add tomato paste, cook 1 min.
3) Pour in broth/water and bring to a boil.
4) Add orzo, simmer 8–10 min until tender.
5) Season with salt/pepper; add dried mint if desired. Serve hot.
Arpa Şehriye Çorbası.nutrition_notes: Comforting soup; moderate carbs from pasta.

Tavuk Çorbası.recipe:
1) Simmer chicken with onion/carrot until cooked; remove and shred.
2) Strain broth if needed, return to pot.
3) Add rice/noodles (optional) and cook until tender.
4) Return shredded chicken.
5) Season; finish with lemon juice (and egg-lemon mix if used). Serve hot.
Tavuk Çorbası.nutrition_notes: Higher protein; good for a filling meal.

Mengen Çorbası.recipe:
1) Sauté onion and pepper in olive oil 3–4 min.
2) Add diced carrot/potato, cook 2 min.
3) Add tomato paste + grated tomato, cook 1–2 min.
4) Add broth/water, simmer 15–20 min.
5) Blend slightly (optional) and season. Serve hot.
Mengen Çorbası.nutrition_notes: Vegetable-forward; higher fiber than noodle soups.

Mantar Çorbası.recipe:
1) Sauté onion + garlic in butter/olive oil.
2) Add sliced mushrooms; cook until they release water and reduce.
3) (Optional) Stir in flour for 1 min.
4) Add broth; simmer 10 min.
5) Add milk/cream, heat gently (don’t boil hard). Season and serve.
Mantar Çorbası.nutrition_notes: Cream adds calories; mushrooms keep it relatively light.

Yayla Çorbası.recipe:
1) Cook rice in water/broth until soft.
2) In a bowl whisk yogurt (+ egg/flour if used) with a ladle of hot soup to temper.
3) Slowly pour the mixture back into the pot, stirring constantly.
4) Heat gently until slightly thickened (do not boil hard).
5) Top with butter + dried mint. Serve hot.
Yayla Çorbası.nutrition_notes: Balanced; dairy boosts protein and calcium.

Tavuk Şinitzel.recipe:
1) Butterfly/flatten chicken breast; season with salt/pepper.
2) Dredge in flour → dip in beaten egg → coat in breadcrumbs.
3) Fry in shallow oil 3–4 min per side until golden and cooked.
4) Drain on paper towel.
5) Serve with rice/potatoes and salad/lemon.
Tavuk Şinitzel.nutrition_notes: High protein; frying increases fat and calories.

Mantarlı et steak.recipe:
1) Season steak; sear on hot pan 2–4 min per side (depending on thickness).
2) Rest meat 5 min.
3) In same pan sauté onion + mushrooms in butter/olive oil.
4) Season with thyme, salt, pepper.
5) Serve steak topped with mushroom mix.
Mantarlı et steak.nutrition_notes: Highest footprint due to beef; very high protein and fat.

Tavuk Tandır (ızgara tavadan).recipe:
1) Mix yogurt + spices + garlic + lemon; marinate chicken 1–8 hours.
2) Heat grill pan; lightly oil.
3) Cook chicken 5–7 min per side until browned and cooked through.
4) Rest 3–5 min.
5) Serve with pilaf/pasta and vegetables.
Tavuk Tandır (ızgara tavadan).nutrition_notes: High protein; moderate carbs if served with sides.

Çökertme Kebabı.name_en: Çökertme Kebab (Beef/Chicken over Crispy Potatoes with Yogurt)
Çökertme Kebabı.recipe:
1) Cut potatoes into thin matchsticks; rinse and dry well.
2) Fry potatoes until crispy; salt lightly.
3) Sauté meat strips with salt/pepper until cooked.
4) Mix yogurt + garlic + salt.
5) Plate: crispy potatoes → garlic yogurt → meat → warm tomato sauce on top.

Tavuk Kalçalı but.recipe:
1) Season chicken with salt/pepper/paprika.
2) Bake at 200°C for 35–45 min (or grill), until juices run clear.
3) Turn once for even browning.
4) Rest 5 min.
5) Serve with bulgur/rice and vegetables.
Tavuk Kalçalı but.nutrition_notes: Very high protein; higher fat than breast.

Pirinç Pilavı.recipe:
1) Rinse rice until water runs clear; soak 10–15 min, drain.
2) Sauté rice in butter/oil 2–3 min.
3) Add hot water/broth (about 1:1.5–1.8), salt.
4) Simmer covered on low until absorbed.
5) Rest 10 min, fluff and serve.
Pirinç Pilavı.nutrition_notes: High carbs; good energy side dish.

Keşkek.recipe:
1) Soak cracked wheat if needed.
2) Simmer wheat with meat/chicken and onion until very soft.
3) Shred meat and beat mixture to a thick porridge texture.
4) Season with salt/pepper.
5) Top with melted butter + paprika and serve.

Tereyağlı Makarna.recipe:
1) Boil pasta in salted water until al dente.
2) Drain (reserve a little pasta water).
3) Return to pot; add butter and a splash of pasta water.
4) Toss until glossy; season.
5) Add cheese if desired.
Tereyağlı Makarna.nutrition_notes: Carb-heavy; butter adds fat and calories.

Şehriyeli Pirinç Pilavı.recipe:
1) Brown vermicelli in butter/oil until golden.
2) Add rinsed rice; sauté 2 min.
3) Add hot water/broth and salt.
4) Simmer covered on low until absorbed.
5) Rest 10 min; fluff and serve.
Şehriyeli Pirinç Pilavı.nutrition_notes: Higher carbs; vermicelli adds a little extra calories.

Tel Şehriyeli bulgur Pilavı.recipe:
1) Toast vermicelli in oil until golden.
2) Add bulgur; stir 1 min.
3) Add water/broth (about 1:2), salt.
4) Simmer covered 12–15 min.
5) Rest 10 min, fluff and serve.
Tel Şehriyeli bulgur Pilavı.nutrition_notes: Higher fiber than rice; good ‘healthier’ carb option.

Nohut Yemeği.recipe:
1) Sauté onion in oil until soft.
2) Add tomato paste and paprika; cook 1 min.
3) Add cooked chickpeas + water/broth.
4) Simmer 15–20 min to thicken.
5) Season and serve with rice/bulgur.
Nohut Yemeği.nutrition_notes: Great plant protein + fiber; lower footprint than meat.

Tazefasulye.name_en: Green Beans in Tomato & Olive Oil
Tazefasulye.recipe:
1) Sauté onion in olive oil.
2) Add trimmed beans; stir 2 min.
3) Add grated tomato + salt/pepper.
4) Cover and simmer 25–35 min until tender.
5) Serve warm or at room temperature.
Tazefasulye.nutrition_notes: Low calorie and fiber-rich; very low footprint.

Ev Usulü Patates.recipe:
1) Cube potatoes; optionally parboil 5 min.
2) Sauté onion in oil.
3) Add potatoes; season with paprika/salt/pepper.
4) Cook covered on low, stirring occasionally, until soft and lightly browned.
5) Serve as a side or vegetarian main.
Ev Usulü Patates.nutrition_notes: Carb-based; moderate calories depending on oil.

Bezelye Yemeği.recipe:
1) Sauté onion in oil.
2) Add carrot (and potato if used) and cook 3–4 min.
3) Add tomato paste; stir 1 min.
4) Add peas + water; simmer 15–20 min.
5) Season and serve.
Bezelye Yemeği.nutrition_notes: Good fiber + plant protein; moderate carbs.

Ispanak Kavurma.recipe:
1) Sauté onion in olive oil.
2) Add washed spinach gradually.
3) Cook 5–7 min until wilted and excess water evaporates.
4) Season; add garlic if desired.
5) Serve as side or with yogurt.

Açık büfe.recipe: Varies. This item represents extra buffet options not specified in the PDF.
Açık büfe.nutrition_notes: Not calculated (depends on what you choose).

Haşhaşlı Tatlı.recipe:
1) Mix eggs + sugar, add milk and oil/butter.
2) Stir in flour + baking powder.
3) Fold in poppy seeds.
4) Bake at 175–180°C until set.
5) Serve as a slice; syrup may be used depending on style.

Kazandibi.recipe:
1) Cook milk + sugar with rice flour/starch until thick.
2) Pour into a tray.
3) Caramelize the bottom by cooking surface on a hot pan/oven until browned.
4) Cool completely.
5) Slice and serve cold.
Kazandibi.nutrition_notes: Dairy-based dessert; moderate protein, higher sugar.

Kestaneli Yaş Pasta.recipe:
1) Prepare sponge layers (or use ready sponge).
2) Whip cream; mix part with chestnut puree for filling.
3) Assemble layers with chestnut cream.
4) Frost with whipped cream/chestnut cream.
5) Chill 2–4 hours before slicing.
Kestaneli Yaş Pasta.nutrition_notes: Rich dessert; high calories and fat.
